vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/c7ef1ece-a170-42e6-80fc-86889073f6e7">USA</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>OECD Structural Analysis (STAN)</i> portfolio includes four databases each useful at different units of analyses. The STAN indicators industry list is based upon International Standard of Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities (ISIC) Revision 3 and covers 65 sectors where detailed information varies across country, indicator, and coverage: STAN fills the gap between industrial survey data (microdata) and national level aggregate statistics (macrodata). STAN can be used to analyse industrial structure and the evolution of industrial performance (e.g. import penetration, investment per employee, export market shares) within and across countries. The databases are updated on an annual basis and run from 1970 onwards.<br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in October 2006. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>OECD Structural Analysis (STAN)</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/structural-analysis.aspx" title="OECD Structural Analysis dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/stan/2010" title="OECD Structural Analysis latest database updates">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (<i>{YYYY}</i>): STructural ANalysis (<i>{Ed. Data download: YYYY-MM}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/stan/2010">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/stan/2010</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/industry-and-services/data/stan-oecd-structural-analysis-statistics_stan-data-en" title="10.1787/stan-data-en">10.1787/stan-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database covers:<ul><li>industry</li><li>import</li><li>export</li><li>industrial performance</li><li>investment per employee</li><li>export market shares</li><li>industrial structure</li><li>international trade</li><li>employment</li><li>productivity</li><li>industrial composition</li><li>business enterprise, research and development, and investment</li><li>output</li><li>labour input</li></ul><br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The OECD Structural Analysis (STAN) runs from 1970 onwards</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Countries covered include: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, United Kingdom, United States, European Union Member States.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>the database is updated annually</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details</sampProc>         <collMode>See documentation for details</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
